sentences.english: POW is still legally bound by the Uniform Code of Military Justice and ethically guided by the Code of Conduct.
sentences.chinese: 戰俘依然受軍法約束，以及軍人守則的道德指導。

sentences.english: POWs excavated three tunnels below this Nazi stronghold.
sentences.chinese: 戰俘們在這個納粹據點地下挖出了三條隧道。

sentences.english: The prisoner felt sorry for him, but there was nothing else he could do.
sentences.chinese: 戰俘爲他感到惋惜，但卻沒有別的選擇。

sentences.english: They captured more than ten thousand prisoners and large quantities of arms in that campaign.
sentences.chinese: 他們在那次戰役中俘獲了一萬多戰俘和大量武器。

sentences.english: The water torture was a favorite among Japanese POW guards during WWII.
sentences.chinese: 水刑是二戰時期日本戰俘守衛最喜歡的一種刑罰。

sentences.english: Yu Manli and Guo Qiyun received a new mission to rescue the labor camps.
sentences.chinese: 於曼麗和郭騎雲接到了新的任務，營救勞工營戰俘。

sentences.english: The Quetzalcóatl corpses are considered to be sacrificed war captives.
sentences.chinese: 羽蛇神的屍體被認爲是將要被祭祀所犧牲的戰俘。

sentences.english: So, Klaette like a prisoner of war as being transferred to the Issa hands.
sentences.chinese: 於是，科萊特又像戰俘一樣地被移交給了埃薩里。

sentences.english: The officer sent him to parley with the enemy for an exchange of prisoners.
sentences.chinese: 指揮官派他去與敵人談判交換戰俘事宜。

sentences.english: They liberated all war prisoners from the concentration camp.
sentences.chinese: 他們將所有戰俘從集中營裏解放出來。

sentences.english: I had also learned that he had been taken prisoner and later died in a POW Camp.
sentences.chinese: 我還知道他被捕，進了監獄，後來死在戰俘營。

sentences.english: The other prisoners of war have also came to the scene, boils down to watch the competition.
sentences.chinese: 其它的戰俘們也紛紛來到現場，觀看此次正邪較量。

sentences.english: Live prisoners were dissected to determine the effects of pathogens on the human body.
sentences.chinese: 戰俘被用來做生化戰的人體實驗。

sentences.english: The father has been a prisoner of war in Russia since 1943.
sentences.chinese: 父親自1943年在蘇聯一場戰役中淪爲戰俘。

sentences.english: The enemy brainwashed all its prisoners in special cells.
sentences.chinese: 敵人給住在特別單人牢房裏的所有戰俘洗腦。

sentences.english: The Japanese prisoners of war were repatriated to their homeland after the war.
sentences.chinese: 日本戰俘於戰後被遣返回國。

pinyin: Di4 er4 Ci4 Shi4 jie4 Da4 zhan4

definition: unfettered and beyond the law (idiom); evading retribution/getting away with it (e.g. crimes)/still at large
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
to execute by firing squad/same as 槍斃|枪毙
